message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with computational geometry and topology, specifically the problem of straightening a self-intersecting closed curve in the plane. This problem is a classic topic in computational geometry and is closely related to the theory of pseudoline arrangements, which suggests that cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the existential theory of the reals, which is a fundamental concept in computational complexity theory, indicating that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) are also likely sub-categories. The paper's use of homotopy theory and semi-algebraic sets suggests that cs.GT (Geometric Topology) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are also possible sub-categories.
